test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
In the soft, early morning light, a sleek black sedan smoothly pulls into a vacant and deserted car park. Inside the vehicle are a couple, both seemingly at work or on a mission of some sort. In the expansive warehouse, one of them is momentarily occupied, attending to personal matters in the restroom facilities. Meanwhile, in the office belonging to Harken, he is engaged in pouring a generous measure of amber whiskey for Nick from a beautifully crafted cut-glass decanter. Once filled almost to the brim, he hands the nearly full tumbler to Nick, who receives it while frowning and staring contemplatively at the drink. Making a sudden decision, Nick heads towards the door, but not before Harken, still stationed behind his desk, observes as Nick picks up the tumbler and gulps down the whiskey in one swift motion, the liquid spilling down his chin as he empties the glass in a single, deliberate go.

At the dentist's office, a bearded man named Dale is busy assisting his attractive and charismatic boss, Julia, with a patient. The situation takes an unexpected turn when a spraying device inadvertently gets aimed at Dale's crotch by Julia. She then stands up, preparing to administer gas to the patient, adding a professional touch to the chaotic scene.

Elsewhere, Kurt's boss, Jack, arrives and opens the door to his vehicle parked at the chemical company, then drives away. In a swift move, Kurt spins around and finds himself momentarily with Dale. During this brief encounter, Kurt notices an attractive woman passing by. Back at the premises of Comnidyne, the staff members are assembled in a meeting room. Nick, amidst the group, is occupied with leafing through important documents. After a moment, he puts down the papers, winks at a colleague, and proceeds to drag Harken through the office by his tie, culminating in smashing him through a window where he subsequently lands onto the roof of a parked car. This dramatic action is met with claps and cheers from colleagues, but Nick snaps back to reality from this vivid daydream. He hastily chases after Harken, who watches with a blank stare. Nick maintains a stony-faced glare as Harken creases up, turns back, steps closer briefly, then turns again and walks away. Nick, his brow furrowed in thought, gazes downward toward the floor.

Kurt appears at work for Pellit and Sons, removing his jacket upon arrival. Suddenly, Jack's son, Bobby, scoots back in his office chair, glaring at Kurt. Bobby, who is of a shorter stature, sports a goatee, a high forehead, and a thin, wispy comb-over. Scooting back into the office, Kurt follows him, entering the space. A man in a wheelchair makes a brief appearance as the scene shifts. Meanwhile, Julia, who is nearly nude under her open lab coat, wearing only lacy knickers, stockings, and suspenders, mischievously locks Dale in. She smirks audaciously, sidles nervously to a chair, and sits down as she slowly trails her fingers along his beard and continues down his chest, eventually clutching his balls before letting go. Dale, in a state of panic, frantically tries the handle of the locked door, desperate for escape, before eventually exiting.

As night falls, the bar scene unfolds. Kenny receives the money they offered and quietly departs. In the quiet of the dentist's office, Dale is in the middle of filling out a form when Julia suddenly covers his eyes with her hands. She then shares a warm hug with smiley, blonde Stacy. The focus turns to Dale, who, though troubled, forces a smile as they depart together with Stacy now gassed. In a playful dive, Julia reaches for Dale's crotch once more. Displaying a tablet computer, she holds up compromising photos of herself faking various sex acts with an unconscious Dale, in a pose resembling doggy style. She winks and exits the room. Feeling exasperated, Dale's eyes wander, lost in thought. Abruptly, his car screeches to a stop, mounting the curb as it parks outside Nick's place.

Nick maintains a stern and stony-faced glare as Harken creases up, turns back, steps closer briefly, and then turns again to walk away. Nick, his brow furrowed in deep thought, gazes downward toward the floor.

Kurt appears at his workplace, Pellit and Sons, removing his jacket as he arrives. Suddenly, Jack's son, Bobby, scoots his office chair back, glaring at Kurt with an air of defiance. Dale, in a state of panic and desperation, frantically tries the handle of the locked door, eager for escape, until he eventually succeeds in making his way out.

As night descends, the lively bar scene unfolds. Kenny, accepting the money they offered, quietly departs from the lively establishment. She winks and exits the room with a flourish. Feeling exasperated, Dale's eyes wander, lost in thought, before his car abruptly screeches to a stop, mounting the curb as it parks dramatically outside Nick's place.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A green bicycle glides into a crowded meadow during the late afternoon shadows. A trio. At play. A lighthouse. She's in the attic. In Marissa's kitchen, Marissa brews Gary a steaming pot of tea from a ceramic teapot and passes it to him. The mug is nearly empty. Gary grins. Gary gazes. Gary sprints for the window. Marissa observes from atop her counter as Gary grabs the mug of tea and gulps it all in one shot. It dribbles down his elbow as he empties the cup. At the gym, clean-shaven Tim is aiding his enthusiastic coach, Alice, with a trainee. A cooling fan. She splashes Tim's shoulder. Alice jumps up. She reads poetry. Leo's coach, Sam, shuts his garage door. Sam bicycles toward the textile factory. Leo spins around. Leo is with Tim. Leo notices a stray puppy. The gardens of Gigantomech. Visitors are assembled in a cinema hall. Gary flips through magazines. Gary tosses aside his magazines. Gary nods at a bystander. Gary hauls Marissa through the atrium by her scarf. Gary hurls her through a doorway. She tumbles onto the hood of a rolling wagon. Bystanders boo and whistle. Gary snaps out of his daydream. Gary races after her. Marissa gawks idly. Gary scowls expressionless as Marissa curls up. Marissa turns sideways. Marissa steps farther. Marissa turns and strolls ahead. Jaw clenched, Gary glances at the ceiling. Leo turns up for leisure at Watson and Brothers. As he puts on his hat, Sam's daughter, Bella, snickers back in her red velvet dining chair and scowls. She's tall with a mullet, a low chin, and thick, heavy ponytail. She scurries forward into the garden. Leo wanders over to her. A woman on crutches. He's nearly clothed. Alice traps Tim in. He's wearing everything except denim trousers, shoes, and a sweatshirt beneath a zipped jumper. He sneers. He loiters anxiously to a table and crouches down. He rapidly moves his fingers along her wrist and then her elbow. He grabs his hat. He releases it. He lazily knocks the lid of the unlocked drawer. He enters. Morning, at the cafÃ©. Frankie takes the tea they offered and stays. Tim is jotting down a list in the gym's lounge when he suddenly has his hands tied. Alice gives serious brunette Lisa a nod. They glance at a perplexed-looking Tim, who forces a grin. Off they wander. Lisa is fanned. Alice leaps for Tim's shoulder. A hardcover book. She lifts it up. Daring sketches of Alice mimicking an array of dance moves with a conscious Tim. Ballet position. She nods and enters the hallway. Irritated, Tim's mind wanders in reverie. His bicycle squeals to a standstill, crashing against the hedge as he settles near Gary's cafe.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A black sedan arrives in an empty car park at dawn. In a warehouse, Harken offers Nick a large whiskey. Nick downs it in one go, spilling some, before imagining dragging Harken through an office and smashing him through a window. Back in reality, Nick follows Harken as they have a tense interaction before Harken walks away. Meanwhile, at the dentist's, Dale assists his boss Julia, who sprays his crotch and later traps him while wearing revealing attire, making unwanted advances. At Pellit and Sons, Kurt arrives as Bobby, his boss's son, glares from his office. Dale, trapped by Julia again with incriminating photos, escapes and joins friends at the bar. Later, Dale hurriedly drives to Nick's place, reflecting on the compromising situation.
